attributes.action: Open places for homeless and people alone to socialise
attributes.background: With Christmas day coming up many people will be spending it alone and walking into new year alone, this petition is to try and get the government to agree to try and fund places for people like this. As people of the community to volunteer to help give the homeless and others to not feel alone.
attributes.additional_details: This may not be an issue for the government to agree on but it could be possible for them to consider funding socialise centres! Yes we have many places for these people like "feed the homeless" but what about the people sat alone on Christmas Day with nobody, reminding themselves they are alone! By signing this it will show the government their funding would be useful and many people in the community would love the opportunity to volunteer. Thankyou for reading please sign! See what we can do.

attributes.action: Open Centres that provide Class A drugs like Heroin for free to prevent crime.
attributes.background: If there were Centers that provided class A drugs for free and a safe place to take them. Users Registered, agreed to treatment. Then Drug dealers would have no business, muggings, robberies and shoplifting would drop dramatically and few young people would start using.
attributes.additional_details: Open centres across the country. While keeping the sale and use of Heroin illegal elsewhere, in the Centres Heroin and other highly addictive class A drugs would be given to addicts that register and seek treatment. Over night drug dealers would be out of business, muggings, robbery’s, burglary’s and shop lifting would decrease dramatically as addicts no longer need to commit crime. Lastly, drug dealers wouldn’t be pushing drugs onto young naïve people in order to profit from their misery.

attributes.action: Consider a Nationalised, funded Mental Health First Response Service.
attributes.background: UK Police Forces and NHS services now spend around 30% of their time responding to Mental Health sufferers who do not receive the best attention or assistance. A MH Service that are the first responders to Suicide risks and Sectioning requests, who can convey MH Patients to the correct facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Working in the Police, it is being increasingly more and more difficult to tackle Crime and deal with Community issues, when every 3 or 4 of 10 incidents we are responding to are for Mental Health patients that require specialised help that we cannot provide. 
This is tying up Emergency resourcing that can be better used elsewhere, and would provide MH patients with the best care and help possible.
Sectioning people and attending Suicide Risks would be better dealt by more a appropriate agency

attributes.action: Release Sharbat Gula
attributes.background:
The “Afghan Girl” who graced an iconic cover of National Geographic magazine in 1985 has been arrested in Pakistan on charges of being in the country illegally.

I call upon the UK government to ask for an immediate release of Sharbat Gula.

I request everyone to sign and share the petition.
attributes.additional_details: Sharbat Gula was 12 years old when she was photographed by Steve McCurry in a refugee camp in Pakistan, in December 1984. The haunting image of the green-eyed girl became an international symbol of refugees and of political and social unrest in the region. It has been widely reproduced, making her one of the most recognizable non-celebrity faces of the 20th century.

attributes.action: Do not cut NHS unsociable hours pay.
attributes.background:
There is talk about fresh contracts to be implemented for the rest of the NHS staff. Due to the national shortage of healthcare professionals and workers, it would not be feasible to cut pay further. 
A lot of NHS staff rely on unsociable hours pay, to feed their families and so forth.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS needs a revamp and a boost, but not at the expense of front-line staff. It is not ideal to venture down this path and it would be an idea to explore other options, as opposed to cutting people's pay. The NHS also needs to encourage future employees and this is a solution, to a recruitment problem.

attributes.action: Allow existing annuities to be transferred into another existing private pension
attributes.background: Government has cancelled previous intention to allow annuities to be sold.

attributes.action: Remove UK passports from disorderly passengers who cause disruption on flights
attributes.background: Media report drunk passengers cause problems & alcohol should be banned on flights. Alcohol is not the problem it is disorderly people. Most travellers enjoy a drink & cause no problems. Like football violence,  remove passports if they cause disruption rather than ban alcohol

attributes.action: Stop educational institutes in the UK from sending farm animals off to slaughter
attributes.background: It has come to our attention that some educational institutes in the UK such as colleges that teach Land-based courses are raising farm animals to be slaughtered for meat. Enough animals in the UK are being farmed for meat and the practice is simply unnecessary. What do the students gain from this?
attributes.additional_details: Some students at the colleges who carry out this practice have been affected and none of the students were aware of the practice before signing up for Land-based courses. A parent of a student who suffered the same trauma of raising animals destined for the slaughterhouse quoted: “We don’t agree that this is how animals should be treated - especially at a learning facility." There are also many viable alternatives for the animals raised such as being released to a sanctuary.

attributes.action: Make employers test for cannabis using the saliva test rather than urine.
attributes.background: The urine test for cannabis is thought to be able to detect cannabis taken from upto 2-3 months prior to the test. This is a massive issue as cannabis has no impairment on your work even a day later. The saliva test used by police for roadside testing only detects cannabis taken that day.
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is used worldwide as medication and although it could affect the way in which you work, the effects wear off after a few hours.

The test for alcohol in a work place can only detect alcohol taken that day or the day before therefore, the same should apply to cannabis.

Unemployment is already a massive issue in the UK and these tests only make it more difficult for people to maintain their employment wether they use recreationally or for medical purposes.

attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown's ban from entering the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Due to the incident involving Rihanna in 2009, Chris Brown was banned from entering the United Kingdom as a result of his 5 year probation. 

Chris Brown was relieved of his probation last year and has not had a major run in with the police since.

He has the right to be allowed in the Uk.
attributes.additional_details:
May 27th 2014 - His daughter was born. Chris Brown has proven to be a good role model since the birth of his daughter. 

Chris Brown suffers from Bipolar Disorder and PTSD

attributes.action: Increase the horsepower of motorcycles to 90bhp for an A2 License holder.
attributes.background: Objective is to increase BHP on a motorcycle for those who ride on an A2 license (19 years of age)
attributes.additional_details: Its unfair that car users, after passing their driving practical exam at 17 years of age can go a buy any car they want (assuming they can afford it , e.g  Ferrari, BMW or any higher performance vehicle) whereas a motorycles user cannot ride anything over 47bhp (A2 license) until they are 21 or 24 years of age. Those who misbehave and abuse such a privillege (if changes commence) must accept and deal with the consequences even if it results in their own injury/death

attributes.action: Introduce Nutrition as a core subject to the National Curriculum
attributes.background: With the ongoing and ever increasing obesity epidemic, young people need to be educated in how to keep their bodies healthy from an early age. By educating them and getting them excited about food and nutrition, I hope that we can help to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015/16 the National Child Measurement Programme revealed that 19.8% of children in Year 6 were obese and a further 14.3% were overweight. Overweight and obese children are likely to become overweight adults and continue to have an increased risk of developing various physical, emotional and psychological problems. The government needs to act now to help solve this crisis by educating the young people of the UK so they are fully informed of how to keep themselves healthy.

attributes.action: Make teaching a nuanced account of the British Empire statutory in KS3 History
attributes.background: In their next revision of the national curriculum, the UK government should update Key Stage 3 history so that teaching about the British Empire is statutory. A nuanced account about the oppressive nature of the empire is needed to education those who are unaware of Britain's problematic empire

attributes.action: Reconsider the decision to remove housing benefit for young people (18 - 21)
attributes.background:
More jobless young people could be made to live on the streets as the Government moves ahead with plans to end housing support payments for under-21s.

On Friday officials published secondary legislation to go ahead with the plans, while most MPs were at home in their constituencies.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference 1:
 http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/housing-benefit-young-people-18-21-scrapped-universal-credit-exemptions-a7610581.html

attributes.action: Ask Mrs May to decide now, what is going to happen to EU citizens living in UK.
attributes.background: Following a referendum held on 23 June 2016, the UK government intends to invoke Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union by the end of March 2017.This would put the UK on a course to leave the EU by March 2019, but we know very little about the terms and consequences for EU citizens living in UK.
attributes.additional_details: As the time to permanently leave the EU quickly approaches, there is very little info on what the terms are going to be for EU citizens that have been living in the UK for years and entered legally.There have been stories about people living here for 30 years, that now face deportation.  This suppose family separation, or having to go live in a country that is not your home and it is not fair.  We want to know now so we can plan the rest of our lives and not be treated as illegal aliens.

attributes.action: Summon the ambassador of the United states of America to the Foreign office
attributes.background: The treatment of British citizen Juhel Miah by American officials in Reykjavik is unacceptable.  We petition Boris Johnson to summon the ambassador of the USA to the Foreign & commonwealth office to explain the reasons for Mr Miah's refusal of entry to the USA and to offer an official apology.
attributes.additional_details:
It would appear Mr Miah has been the victim of racial profiling and has been given no reason for the denial of his entry to the United States of America. He was not allowed to board a plane in Iceland (bound for the USA) and given no explanation. 

He was travelling to the USA on a school trip as a teacher. 

There has been no response or reason for his treatment given by US officials or the embassy. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Legislate so children can get hot meals free during school holidays
attributes.background: Children on free school meals are not able to access food 170 days a year during school holidays and are going hungry

attributes.action: Make vaccinations for Meningitis B available to all babies and children!
attributes.background: After seeing another child lost to meningitis B in the news we need to address that there is a vaccination available for £155 but the government won't routinely provide it to our children. We need to change this, the government must act on this now-too many lives have been lost, let's prevent more!
attributes.additional_details: How can the government put a price on our children's lives?!

attributes.action: Bring back the YTS scheme for the many small businesses.
attributes.background: I am a blacksmith (I am 54), i would love to pass on my skills and keep teach a young person the ropes, however as a small business myself, we just break even as i have invested all our profit into new equipment, i looked into having an apprentice and its currently impossible

attributes.action: Introduce stricter air pollution laws in the uk eg. stronger fines.
attributes.background: This year 24 areas in London reached the highest recorded levels of pollution in 5 years. This also happened in several areas in Western Europe effecting people with breathing disabilities. We need to lead in environmental issues as we have great influence. This will prompt other countries to follow
attributes.additional_details: The information is a reference to the observers article on pollution, published on the 29th January 2017 (Sunday) titled: Smog In the cities: the truth about Britain's dirty air.

attributes.action: Assaults on emergency personnel the same penalty as assaulting a police officer
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Officer. This type of abuse must be severely dealt with.
attributes.additional_details: Having known personnel in the emergency service and hearing they are abused nearly everyday.  We have a duty to support them like they do us, when we need them to save our lives.

attributes.action: Fine people who smoke on hospital grounds or have security to escort them out!
attributes.background: I not only work in the nhs and see this on a daily basis .But I now have a 12 day old baby born at 25 weeks fighting for her life. And where people smoke in the hospital grounds the ward she is on is right above where everyone smokes and it travels right to her window! I've argued many times with
attributes.additional_details: The inconsiderate people smoking out the entrance of the ward. But they do not care and do not move as they know there is no one there to stop them! You can smell the smoke all through the corridor of the hospitals entrances . And other staff members don't even think to question the people doing it.They even sit in the wheel chairs outside smoking .Do the wheelchairs even get cleaned for when the porter needs it for the next patient? The signs are not enough !! This is at st Georges hospital.

attributes.action: Make the licencing fee for the BBC optional.
attributes.background: The BBC has an obvious left wing agenda, I don't watch the BBC but because I have the ability to receive it, forces me to pay for it, Surely in this age of technology it can be a "Pay per view" channel.

attributes.action: Make All Public Parking including Hospitals 'FREE' for the Disabled
attributes.background:
It is a disgrace to make these pay, it it hit and miss with some charging and others not, should be the same throughout the country, I know some abuse the system with Blue Badges and should lose them for ever, the charges incurred it a lot of money for Disabled people.
We need a Three Hour system.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospitals make a lot of money already on poorly people, the Disabled should not be one, this is being Anti Disabled and must not be discriminated against.

Let's get things put in order with a system that the Disabled do not have to study each place on if they can or can not.

Disabled Agency sorts some things but money matters to these people on Low income.

attributes.action: Provide funding to migrate all NHS systems from Windows XP for security reasons
attributes.background: Barts NHS trust has just been hit with a ransomware attack, it was running Windows XP. 30 percent of all NHS trusts have been hit by ransomware according to an FOI request by Sentinel One. Moving off Windows XP is efficient, Imperial College NHS Trust found they cut help desk calls by 60 percent.
attributes.additional_details:
Upgrade from Windows XP would be a good start but proper endpoint security is needed to protect against ransomware. Dynamic endpoint protection and DNS level filtering. Anti malware and anti exploit protection is also necessary. 
http://www.computing.co.uk/ctg/news/3002565/barts-nhs-trust-windows-xp-pcs-infected-with-suspected-ransomware 
http://www.dclsearch.com/nhs-trusts-a-magnet-for-ransomware-foi-disclosures-reveal-it-security-news/ 
http://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/01/17/nhs_ransomware/

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for any councillor to fail to pay council tax.
attributes.background: As a lawyer and council tax payer I read of an increasing number of councillors who fail to pay their council tax and this problem cannot be allowed to continue

attributes.action: Repeal the VED legislation Changes coming into force in April 2017
attributes.background: The proposed VED changes coming into force in April 2017 mean it is no longer an incentive to buy a low polluting car.
attributes.additional_details:
The new changes introduce the same basic charge on each subsequent year of ownership after the first year of ownership meaning if someone bought a 1 year old high polluting car they would pay the same tax as a 1 year old low polluting car removing the incentive to buy the economical car.

A much fairer system would be to move all of the band thresholds down so the emissions target for £0 VED is now 80g/km for example. And the 100g/km band now pays £30 a year and so on.

attributes.action: Reduce the Overseas Aid Budget from 0.7% of GDP to 0.6% of GDP.
attributes.background: The UK Overseas Aid Budget at 0.71% is the 5th highest of all European countries.   I suggest that it is reduced to 0.6% and that the cash difference be invested in our NHS.   The reduction amounts to approximately £1.4bn p.a.and so would fund the increasing needs of the NHS on an annual need.
attributes.additional_details:
With increasing demands on the NHS through an ageing and increasing population, the NHS needs more money.   We spend 8.5% of GDP (based on 2015 data) against an average in Europe of 8.9% and are the 10th highest spender of 10 listed countries.   We are the 5th higher contributor to Overseas Aid of 10 listed countries.  Germany & France spend considerably less on Overseas Aid than the UK - but considerably more on their NHS.  
Sources:  Wikepedia & Kings Fund

attributes.action: Change the law from late miscarriage to stillbirth.
attributes.background: I myself have had a stillbirth at 34 weeks just 9 month ago and I was outraged to discover that any children born before 24 weeks are categorised as a miscarriage. I want this changed.
attributes.additional_details: Many people don't realise that at this time the mother must give birth to their baby which is often fully formed. They hold them, love them and name them and yet they are non existent is the eyes of the law. They will not be offered a birth or death certificate or a funeral. This is heart breaking for the parents and family. I would like the law changed from miscarriage to still birth from the day any mother has to physically give birth to a baby.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of hard wired electrical accessories to the general public.
attributes.background: Many house fires and potentially dangeous situations regarding the electeical installations in dwellings are caused by poor workmanship on electrical installations. The main reason for this is due to the availability of hard wired accessories to the general public, who then fit them themselves
attributes.additional_details: Many people will not touch the plumbing in thier house due to the possibility of a leak thus causing damage, but will happily tamper with the electrical installation of their own homes and sometimes others as they believe they know what they are doing but in reality, do not have the slightest clue and are totally incompetent to touch such systems. These people are putting peoples lives at risk everyday and are able to do so as anybody can purchase the equipment without proof of competence to fit

attributes.action: Divert 50% of the foreign aid budget to tackle social care for the aged in uk
attributes.background: More councils in the uk are short of funds to tackle social care in the UK.(12 billion foreign aid budget wasted on rogue nations/state officials), to go directly to councils, so that they do not in turn raise their taxes, which are currently too high now.
attributes.additional_details: This will help to pay for more care homes and after care for the elderly and release more beds in hospitals so that we can all benefit. With an ageing population, If this situation is not tackled this way, then bigger problems will arise. It is on best affordable way forward to this and still retains 50% of the foreign aid budget, which should be more scrutinised than currently is or scrapped altogether.

attributes.action: Make it law for drivers to slow down and move over when they see roadworkers
attributes.background: every year a number of recovery operators and roadside technicians and other roadworkers are killed because of people not giving enough room when we are working on motorways. when they see flashing orange beacons slow down and move over to the middle lane to give us enough room to work safely

attributes.action: Public enquiry:Investigate state of prisons. Bring British Army in to help staff
attributes.background: Prison staff are unable to cope with the safe running of our prisons. Staff and inmates safety must be priority. Promises of more staff have not been fulfilled. More training is needed for prison roles. Health and safety practice is poor. Begin a public enquiry. In the meantime; bring in our Army.
attributes.additional_details: Inmates rehabilitation is not to the standards that they could be. Inmates need guidance. The ratio of inmates per staff member is unreasonable. Thus, staff suffer and potentially risk their safety. Prison staff are over-worked and not paid enough in light of the work that they undertake. Inmates are often not in receipt of adequate care. The lack of rehabilitation of offenders affects all parts of our society. It is time to stop ignoring inmates and staff members needs.

attributes.action: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1%
attributes.background: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1% to be used exclusively for the NHS & Social Care. With the NHS and Social Care in turmoil both facing unprecedented funding shortages, it is time for the UK workforce to help further fund these services.
attributes.additional_details: Polling has shown that 48% would support a 1% increase in national insurance contributions to go towards the NHS and Social Care.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for office buildings to keep interior lighting on after hours.
attributes.background: Whilst out and about London recently on a Saturday night, I was struck by how many empty office buildings were lit up across the city with nobody at their desks. This is a massive waste of energy and resources and flies in the face of the Government commitment to reducing carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Make audio recording in meetings about children and vunerable adults mandatory.
attributes.background:
Children, vulnerable adults and their carers are suffering. 
I am concerned about neglect, lying and professional backwatching in schools and care services. All meetings should be audio recorded and a copy given to those discussed, their carer and all attendees.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/12/10/parents-allowed-record-child-protection-meetings/

Producing copies of an audio recording for all involved in meetings within the care/education system would reduce abusive behaviour, unprofessionalism, lying, inaccuracies and would help to stop recordings taken out of context and placed on social media.
No more hiding behind 'their word against ours'. Let's have proper transparency when it comes to our children's wellbeing and protecting our vulnerable.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Safe Haven' law for abandoned babies in the UK
attributes.background: Around 500 babies are abandoned each year in the UK, that's 9 a week! Here in the UK its currently illegal to leave a baby in a safe place if the parent feels they can no longer look after them, but in all 50 states of America they have a 'Safe haven' law to protect vulnerable children and parents
attributes.additional_details:
The safe haven law allows unharmed children under 3 weeks of age to be surrendered anonymously and safely to a designated place with no questions asked. This insures that babies are not abandoned in cold or dangerous conditions or worse still neglected. 
Whilst this is a highly emotive issue, this law will not encourage pregnant women to abandon their children, what it will do is protect societies most venerable and those that need it most the babies. Please help me protect the these babies.

attributes.action: Make Universal Credit an optional benefit.
attributes.background: Many people will find they get less under Universal Credit than they would have done under one of the previous benefits that it replaces. While Universal Credit has a transfer top up amount up amount this will not do anything to help new claimants out in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Therefor it would be reasonable to request that the government does NOT make Universal Credit the only option by allowing people to choose either Universal Credit or the benefits that apply to them out of the 6 benefits that Universal Credit replaces.

attributes.action: Make universal credit phone numbers free
attributes.background: Sign this because it is ridiculous to phone up for help with benefits and money and to have a huge phone bill at the end!

attributes.action: Legalize the medicinal use and sale of Cannabis via prescription.
attributes.background:
Millions of people throughout the world and in the UK suffer from conditions of which Cannabis offers a significant and harmless relief. 
To name a few:
-Glaucoma
-Seizures (Dravet's syndrome)
-Alzheimer's Disease
-Multiple Sclerosis
-Arthritis
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.who.int/medicines/access/controlled-substances/6_2_cannabis_update.pdf

http://www.encod.org/info/700-MEDICINAL-USES-OF-CANNABIS.html

attributes.action: Dedicate July 1st as a bank holiday in memory of princess Diana.
attributes.background: Princess Diana was a prominent member of British history and deserves to be remembered for her contributions to her charity work and her support of the International Campaign to ban landmines. This bank holiday could replace the Whitsun bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: The Whitsun bank holiday has become outdated and lost its meaning to the general public. We propose that the Princess Diana bank holiday would be more suitable, as it's closer to the nations heart. Her continued support for Great Ormand Street and other charities has allowed her to become an iconic role model for younger generations to aspire to be like. July 1st marks her birthday and a bank holiday on this day would allow the British public to remember and celebrate her and her achievements.

attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: Change of Law: MPs must stand down after serving a constituency for 10 years.
attributes.background: Nearly 10% of current UK MPs have been active for over 25 years. Nearly 20% of MPs have been active for over 20 years. The world has changed vastly since 1996, yet nearly 1/5 of MPs have been serving since then. Excessive continuous service prevents real political change for the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Rt Hon. Sir Gerald Kaufman, The Rt Hon. Kenneth Clarke, The Rt Hon. Michael Meacher & Dennis Skinner have been active since 1970 - nearly 37 years making decisions for our country. The term 'Father of the House' is unsettling. We should be a progressive country, not a frozen one. Change is healthy. Fresh ideas and fresh actions are needed now more than ever.

attributes.action: Fly the Union Flag on Government Buildings on Armistice Day
attributes.background:
Current recommendations from the Department for Culture, Media and Sport do not require government buildings to fly the Union Flag on Armistice Day, 11th November.
It is recommended for Remembrance Sunday, but the omission of Armistice Day from the list is an oversight that should be corrected.
attributes.additional_details:
Armistice Day is 11 November. We pause to observe the Two Minute Silence at 11:00 on this day every year because at the 11th hour, on the 11th day of the 11th month in 1918, World War I ended. During this time, we remember those who have made sacrifices for the freedom we enjoy today.

The British Legion recommends flying the flag on Armistice Day.

http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/263/~/remembrance-faqs
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/designated-days-for-union-flag-flying

attributes.action: Set a time limit of 2 weeks on JSA and ESA decisions to reduce claimants' stress
attributes.background: The film "I, Daniel Blake" gave a vivid and true-to-life description of the possible consequences of long delays waiting for official decisions from the Job Centre et al. The system appears designed to grind down claimants, and cause the greatest hardship. The current system is cruel and degrading.

attributes.action: Add the option for 'None of the Above' on Local / General Election Ballot Papers
attributes.background: Voting is being effected by the lack of a direct, quantifiable outlet for frustrated people to express themselves.It causes negative voting and confused issues. People should have a way to say candidates/campaigns tactics are not good enough;if say 25% reached a rerun with new candidates triggered.
attributes.additional_details: Voting should be a positive experience. i.e FOR someone or something. Too often, the choice is often about the 'least worst option'. The ballot paper needs to give a credible alternative.The electorate needs a way to encourage postive campaigning and ultimately reject a set of bad candidates.I believe by giving everyone the option of quanitfiably registering their frustration with candidates/campaigns we can force politicians away from devisive language and personal attacks & increase turn out.

attributes.action: Private companies must allow 10 minutes before issue of a parking invoice.
attributes.background: Many retail parks, housing developments and busimesses use private parking companies to control parking in their carparks or roads. We believe these companies should be legally required to allow the driver to overstay by a maximum of ten minutes, just as traffic wardens and council wardens have to.
attributes.additional_details: If you are held up at the till because there are not enough staff at the checkouts, is it fair to be charged by the parking company that the store employs? Is it right to receive a ticket because you pulled up at your door to unload shopping before taking your car to the official car park? No, it isn't. These charges are exhorbitant and unfair. They should have to allow at least a few minutes grace before pouncing and issuing a fine.

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when traffic jams are a mile back.
attributes.background:
To make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when tailback/traffic jams are a mile back.
We shouldn't have to pay for something that should've been free years ago.
The highways agency and sanef should sort this out.
Doing away with the barriers has made traffic tailbacks worse!

attributes.action: Ban the use of driverless cars before it's too late.
attributes.background: They are danger to other road users. An absurd idea and will cause the death of many pedestrians that could of been avoided. If you don't want to drive then get a taxi. They are not safe for anyone other than the passenger.
